intro: Lycianthes gorgonea, commonly known as the Gorgonea nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals.
